medical_history.chief_complaint: Vaginal bleeding in a postmenopausal woman.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Approximately 1 month prior to the visit, the patient noted a brown vaginal discharge. Vaginal bleeding developed 18 days before seeking medical attention. During the week following the onset of bleeding, pelvic ultrasonography was performed, revealing a thickened endometrial lining.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient has a history of infiltrating ductal carcinoma of the right breast diagnosed 10 years prior, treatment for which included lumpectomy, chemotherapy, radiation, and tamoxifen. She also has a history of osteoporosis, hypercholesterolemia, and hypothyroidism.
medical_history.family_history: Her parents died of heart disease in their 90s; a maternal grandfather died of pancreatic cancer at age 70, and a maternal uncle died of liver cancer at age 60. Her brother, children, and grandchildren are reported to be healthy.
medical_history.social_history: The patient lives with her husband and does not smoke or drink alcohol.
